page.title: 19HACKLINGE AREA LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: In a region rich in history, Ham is the only place mentioned in Domesday Book. The remains of the most ancient monument are those of a Romano-British Temple lying under the surface near the end of Jubilee Road, Worth. Many people from outside the village are seen with metal detectors and, sadly, any finds are removed by them though occasionally Roman coins are found in nearby gardens. "Igguldene" at Burgess Green was the Toll House on the old Deal/Sandwich road which can still be followed through Finglesham and Ham to join the present road at Worth Cross Roads. Cottington Court Farm is built on the ruins of Cotmanton Monastery. The sea which in 1446 came up to the back of the chapel is now 2km. away to the east.
